Photonis: Oh, but of course! Mmm... Would you rather walk, or get a
ride back to base?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> "Interesting... I will come with you. Lead on." he said, still seeming
> confused, but intrigued at why someone would want to rescue him from
that
> pod.
> 
>  On 9/30/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> >
> > Photonis: Memory failure, mmm? If you wish, I can check out if there
> > are damages to your memory drives later on...
> >
> > Photonis turned away to show the landscape with his appendices.
> >
> > Photonis: ...As for what this place is, it is Earth! We have settled
> > here a few decades earlier, and now cities and plants are bustling
> > everywhere!Of course, I have a theory that says we will pack up and
> > leave at one point because, after all, we were not there when humans
> > discovered the Autobots and Decepticons, but that is another matter.
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > "My name...."
> > > He kept his head bowed slightly, narowing his red eyes and
continuing to
> > > glare at Photonis.
> > > "My name is Trelos.... what is this place? Where am I.... I can't
> > remember
> > > anything."
> > > He finally stopped glaring to look at the large sword that he was
> > holding
> > > in his right hand. Then he turned his head back up and glared at
> > Photonis.
> > >
> > > On 9/28/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Photonis was pleased. This would be a fine addition to the Iron
> > Skulls...
> > > >
> > > > Photonis: Ah! I see you awake! Good, very good indeed! I am
Photonis.
> > > > There were some problems with your pod, so I came all the way from
> > > > Olympus to fix you up to the best of your capacities. What is your
> > name?
> > > >
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > >Initiating....
> > > > > >Cycle complete.... opening hatch
> > > > > The pod began to emit some excess gas, then the hatch
opened, and a
> > > > > relatively tall bot stepped out. He had dark metal armor and
patches
> > > > of grey
> > > > > fir on the shoulders, back, arms and legs. Ignoring his rescuer,
> > he bent
> > > > > down to remove some items from the storage box on the pod: his
> > > > weapons and a
> > > > > box that he attached to his waist. He then looked up. Seeming
> > > > surprised that
> > > > > someone was standing there, he flinched and took a step back
> > raising his
> > > > > arms as if to block an attack. When no attack came, he glared at
> > > > Photonis
> > > > > with his deep red eyes.
> > > > > On 9/23/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Photonis: Ah! There we are!
> > > > > >
> > > > > > > RESUME NORMAL PROCEDURE
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > The pod made a humming sound as the protoform was fused
with a
> > > > > > synthesized
> > > > > > > dna sample.
> > > > > > > "Initiating protoform dna integration." the computer said.
> > > > > > > The noises stopped and the screen read:
> > > > > > > >Protoform integration complete.
> > > > > > > >Please enter command....
> > > > > > > OOC: sorry, I thought that I was waiting for you to reply,
> > but it
> > > > > > looked
> > > > > > > like I just didn't see your reply. >_<
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > On 9/11/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Photonis: Oh, that's just it... Might have been worse...
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > He typed again.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > >Y
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi
<kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > >DNA sample in buffer, apply DNA sample? (Y/N)
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > On 9/6/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > Photonis did not like that. Errors were usually
not a good
> > > > thing.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > >Error details
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi
> > <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > >Reformat accepted.... affiliation and
programming...
> > > > > > overwriting.
> > > > > > > > > > > >error when rewriting files 272ac.49a, 273de.49a
> > > > > > > > > > > >Reformat complete... awaiting next command....
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > On 9/3/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > Photonis typed again.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > REFORMAT AFFILIATION AND PROGRAMING
> > > > > > > > > > > > > SET PREDACON AS NEW
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > He installed a predacon chip in the pod and waited
> > for the
> > > > > > pod's
> > > > > > > > > > response.
> > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi
> > > > <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Most Recent Affiliation:Unknown
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Programming: Soldier/Prison Guard/Basic
Piloting
> > > > Skills
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > .........
> > > > > > > > > > > > > The cursor blinked as the computer awaited
further
> > > > > > instructions.
> > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > On 8/29/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > OOC: just a means of letting Photonis have
is fun
> > > > > > without time
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > limits... basically, it pauses what the pod is
> > > > currently
> > > > > > > > doing.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > BIC:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Photonis: Good... good... You, my pretty,
are very
> > > > > > docile...
> > > > > > > > > > hehehe...
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > He typed some more.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > >PROGRAMING AND ALLIEGEANCE?
> > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi
> > > > > > <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > POD: Condition -> Healthy
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Pod has scanned a DNA sample, hit 1 to
> > > > continue with
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > protoform DNA integration.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > press 4 to cancel, pod will activate
> > automatically
> > > > > > in 10
> > > > > > > > > > minutes.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >FREZE ACTION
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > OOC: What does a freeze action do exactly?
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On 8/28/05, Nic <gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > As Photonis arrinved, he transformed into
> > his bot
> > > > > > mode. It
> > > > > > > > > > was a
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > clumsy-looking four-legged mode, a bit
like a
> > > > turtle,
> > > > > > > > but with
> > > > > > > > > > > > a long
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > utility device on his back that could
be used
> > > > as both
> > > > > > > > cannon
> > > > > > > > > > > > or crane.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Photonis had no hands per se. However,
he had
> > > > built
> > > > > > > > > > himself tiny
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > nano-powered tentacles that could be
used to a
> > > > > > marvelous
> > > > > > > > > > degree of
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > precision. With it, he began to check the
> > pod, and
> > > > > > > > inserted a
> > > > > > > > > > > > freeze
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > action command in the program. He then
> > asked it
> > > > > > for the
> > > > > > > > > > status.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, rm2kmidi
> > > > > > > > <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > The pod's signal grew stronger.
Although its
> > > > > > outside was
> > > > > > > > > > badly
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > scratched,
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > structurally it appeared to be in
one piece.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On 8/22/05, Nic
<gestaltproject@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > The signal reached the personal
monitor of
> > > > High
> > > > > > > > Researcher
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Photonis.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > He was a bulky and awkward looking
> > > > transformer,
> > > > > > > > but his
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > processor was
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > the kind of thing that made Lord
Jotunn
> > > > smile with
> > > > > > > > > > pleasure
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > with the
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > things it produced. Thus, a pod nearby
> > > > > > attracted his
> > > > > > > > > > > > attention. He
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > left the base on the four legs of his
> > robot
> > > > > > mode, then
> > > > > > > > > > > > outside,
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > tranformed into a high velocity
> > > > hovercraft, and he
> > > > > > > > > > sped to the
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > pod.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com,
rm2kmidi
> > > > > > > > > > <kraftlos@g...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > A pod began emitting a signal
about 40
> > > > > > minutes away
> > > > > > > > > > from the
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Olympus
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Complex.
